description: Change of use of single residential unit (Use Class C3) to House in Multiple Occupation (Use Class C4) with a maximum occupancy of 10 persons (6 bedrooms); single storey side/rear (wrap around) extension, following removal of ground floor side bay window; roof extension to rear (main) roof slope; part rear roof extension to rear outrigger roof slope; alteration to external elevations, involving installation of windows to upper floor side elevation; single storey detached garden outbuilding for use as office/multi purpose area; provision of refuse and cycle stores
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title(s): DWG000 Rev E OS Data; DWG001 Rev E Existing Plans; DWG002 Rev E Existing Plans; DWG003 Rev E Existing Plans; DWG021 Rev E Existing Elevations; DWG022 Rev E Existing Elevations; DWG031 Rev E Existing Sections; DWG100 Rev E PR Site Plan as Indicated; DWG106 Rev E PR Site Plan; DWG101 Rev E Proposed Plans; DWG102 Rev E Proposed Plans; DWG103 Rev E Proposed Plans; DWG104 Rev E Proposed Plans; DWG103 Rev E Proposed Plans; DWG201 Rev E Proposed Elevations; DWG202 Rev E OS Data; DWG203 Rev E OS Data; DWG301 Rev E Proposed Sections.

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building and shall be consistent with those as listed within the submitted application form and the drawings / plans as listed in Condition (2).

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with the Council's adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) policies 7.4, 7A and 7B, policies 1.1 (h), 1.2 (g) and 2.10 of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021).
| The maximum number of persons occupying the house in multiple occupation hereby approved shall be limited to no more than 10 people in 6 bedrooms .

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013), policy 1.1 (e) of the Ealing Development Strategy 2026 (2012) and policies D3 and D6 of the London Plan (2021). | No cooking facilities shall be installed at any time in any of the rooms. All cooking and preparation of hot food shall take place within the communal kitchen on the ground floor.

Reason: To ensure that the HMO rooms are not wholly self-contained and to protect the amenity of the occupants of each of the rooms and neighbouring properties, in accordance with Policy D6 of the London Plan, Policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD and Council HMO Licensing Guidelines. | The proposed cycle parking structure in the front garden shown on the approved plans shall be implemented in full prior to occupation of the property and retained thereafter.

Reason: To promote more sustainable forms of transportation, in accordance with Policy T5 of the London Plan. | Notwithstanding the approved plans, refuse/recycling storage shall be provided in accordance with Council policies and brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained thereafter, as shown on the approved plans.

Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, to protect amenity of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies with policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan 2013, policy 1.1(e) of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy and policies SI7 and SI8 of the London Plan (2021). | The planters to the front forecourt shall be provided, prior to occupation of the building and retained for the life of the development hereby approved.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D14 of the London Plan (2021), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | The site is within the worst mode aircraft 1-day noise contour predicted for 2016 (60 dB). The sound insulation of the building envelope shall achieve the internal criteria for sensitive rooms, as specified in Supplementary Planning Guidance 10. If compliance requires the windows to be closed, then acoustically attenuated mechanical ventilation and cooling shall be installed as necessary (with air intake from the cleanest aspect of the building).  The above shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D6 and D14 of The London Plan (2021), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of an enhanced sound insulation value of at least 5dB above the maximum Building Regulations value, for the floor/ceiling/wall structures separating different types of rooms/uses, namely, communal main entrance and bathrooms adjoining bedrooms. The assessment and mitigation measures shall have regard to standards of the Council's SPG10 and noise limits specified in BS8233:2014. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with Policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2021), Standard 30 of the Housing SPG and Policy D14 of the London Plan (2021). | The window/s inserted in the side elevations shall be obscure glazed and non-opening (where openable parts less than 1.7m above floor) unless otherwise confirmed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To safeguard neighbouring amenity from light pollution in accordance with policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013) and policy D6 of the London Plan (2021). | No part of the roof of the building shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of nearby properties in accordance with policies D4 and D6 of The London Plan (2021), polices 7.4, 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013) and polices 1.1 (e)(g), 1.2 (f), 2.1(c) and 2.10 the Ealing Core Strategy (2012). | The proposed rooflights hereby approved shall not project more than 150mm from the roof plane and retained as such for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: To minimise light spillage and interference with the privacy and outlook of adjoining occupiers and in the interests of good neighbourliness and in accordance with policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | The detached rear outbuilding shall only be used for purposes incidental to the enjoyment of the development hereby approved, and shall not be used for habitable accommodation, as an independent dwelling or any industrial, commercial or business use.

Reason: To ensure that the development does not detract from the amenity of the adjoining properties, and to enable the Local Planning Authority to retain control over the use of the building in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 & D6 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | No kitchen facilities shall be installed in the outbuilding at any time.

Reason: To prevent the creation of a separate self-contained residential unit of accommodation in the interests of the living conditions of the existing and future residents of the site and to ensure that the use of the building does not, by reason of any other activity, harm the living conditions in the area, in accordance with policies 1.1,1.2 & 3.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012) and Policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), Policies D3 and D6 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
